title.value: Single-cell multi-omic topic embedding reveals cell-type-specific and COVID-19 severity-related immune signatures
title.justification: The title of the paper, as mentioned at the beginning
title.quote: Single-cell multi-omic topic embedding reveals cell-type-specific and COVID-19 severity-related immune signatures

extractions.description: The study proposes an interpretable deep learning method called multi-omic embedded topic model (moETM) for integrative analysis of single-cell multimodal data. The method uses a product-of-experts for variational inference and multiple linear decoders to learn multi-omic signatures. moETM demonstrates superior performance compared to six state-of-the-art methods on seven public datasets and reveals insights into immune signatures.

type.justification: The paper presents a new method, moETM, and empirically evaluates its performance on multiple datasets using various metrics.
type.quote: In this study, we propose an interpretable deep learning method called multi-omic embedded topic model (moETM) to effectively perform integrative analysis of high-dimensional single-cell multimodal data... Through comprehensive experiments on public single-cell transcriptome and chromatin accessibility data (i.e., scRNA+scATAC), as well as scRNA and proteomic data (i.e., CITE-seq), moETM demonstrates superior performance compared with six state-of-the-art single-cell data analysis methods on seven publicly available datasets.

name.justification: The primary focus is on developing computational methods for biology, especially for analyzing single-cell multi-omic data.
name.quote: The advent of single-cell multi-omics sequencing technology makes it possible for researchers to leverage multiple modalities for individual cells and explore cell heterogeneity.

name.justification: The paper introduces and utilizes a deep learning method for data analysis.
name.quote: In this study, we propose an interpretable deep learning method called multi-omic embedded topic model (moETM) to effectively perform integrative analysis of high-dimensional single-cell multimodal data.

name.justification: The method is designed to analyze biological data from high-throughput sequencing technologies.
name.quote: Through comprehensive experiments on public single-cell transcriptome and chromatin accessibility data (i.e., scRNA+scATAC), as well as scRNA and proteomic data (i.e., CITE-seq), moETM demonstrates superior performance compared with six state-of-the-art single-cell data analysis methods on seven publicly available datasets.

name.justification: This is the main model proposed in the paper.
name.quote: In this study, we propose an interpretable deep learning method called multi-omic embedded topic model (moETM) to effectively perform integrative analysis of high-dimensional single-cell multimodal data.

is_contributed.justification: moETM is the main contribution of this study.
is_contributed.quote: In this study, we propose an interpretable deep learning method called multi-omic embedded topic model (moETM) to effectively perform integrative analysis of high-dimensional single-cell multimodal data.

is_executed.justification: The model was executed and evaluated on multiple datasets to demonstrate its effectiveness.
is_executed.quote: Through comprehensive experiments on public single-cell transcriptome and chromatin accessibility data (i.e., scRNA+scATAC), as well as scRNA and proteomic data (i.e., CITE-seq), moETM demonstrates superior performance compared with six state-of-the-art single-cell data analysis methods on seven publicly available datasets.

is_compared.justification: moETM's performance was compared with six state-of-the-art methods.
is_compared.quote: moETM demonstrates superior performance compared with six state-of-the-art single-cell data analysis methods on seven publicly available datasets.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Variational inference, a key component of moETM, is based on Variational Autoencoders. This reference is to the foundational paper by Kingma and Welling.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We then took a variational inference approach to optimize the model parameters by maximizing an evidence lower bound (ELBO) of the marginal log likelihood...

name.justification: BMMC dataset is one of the main datasets used for evaluation in the study.
name.quote: For the BMMC1 dataset, we take into account two different batch types: one treats a subject (eg. site1 + donor1 as a subject s1d1, site1 + donor2 as a subject s1d2, etc) as a batch (s1d1, s1d2, s1d3, s2d1, s2d4, s2d5, s3d3, s3d6, s3d7, s3d10, s4d1, s4d8, s4d9, 13 batches in total), while the other treats a site (site1 as batch1, site2 as batch2) as a batch (4 batches in total).

referenced_paper_title.value: A sandbox for prediction and integration of dna, rna, and proteins in single cells
referenced_paper_title.justification: This dataset is taken from the 2021 NeurIPS challenge related to prediction and integration of DNA, RNA, and proteins in single cells.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The Multiome bone marrow mononuclear cells (BMMC1) dataset from the 2021 NeurIPS challenge consisting of 42,492 cells with 22 cell types from 10 donors across 4 sites

name.justification: The library is used for preprocessing the datasets.
name.quote: The read count for each gene and peak were first normalized per cell by total counts within the same omic using scanpy.pp.normalize_total function in the scanpy...

referenced_paper_title.value: Scanpy: large-scale single-cell gene expression data analysis
referenced_paper_title.justification: The library is used for normalizing the single-cell data in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The read count for each gene and peak were first normalized per cell by total counts within the same omic using scanpy.pp.normalize_total function in the scanpy...
